main event: On October 6, 1967, a circular, luminous object was observed hovering over Brooklyn, New York, for approximately 3-5 minutes before disappearing.
interesting points: The object was described as round and approximately 30-40 feet in diameter, hovering at an altitude of 1,000-2,000 feet., The witness observed the object from a public park and reported it was bright silver and metallic., The weather conditions were clear, allowing for excellent visibility during the sighting., The report indicates the object exhibited no visible means of propulsion., The incident has been classified as UNIDENTIFIED with no known explanation.
witness description: The witness was a private citizen observing from a public park and was identified as a housewife with her family.
